intro: Eriosorus novogranatensis, commonly known as the Brazilian moss fern, is a species of fern native to South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hair-like fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Eriosorus novogranatensis plays a role in maintaining soil stability and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
